name: Minnesota GI Bill
description: Provides up to $15,000 for eligible Minnesota veterans, currently serving troops, National Guard and Reserve members who served after September 11, 2001. Available until age 62. Can be used for higher education, on-the-job training, apprenticeships, licenses and certifications. Also available to certain spouses and children.
eligibility: Minnesota resident veteran OR currently serving OR Guard/Reserve
Certain spouses and children also eligible
benefit_amount: Maximum $15,000 lifetime benefit
how_to_apply: Apply through Minnesota Department of Veterans Affairs

name: Property Tax Exclusion ($150,000)
description: Up to $150,000 market value exclusion from property taxes for veterans with 70% or greater VA service-connected disability. Also available to qualifying primary family caregivers of 70%+ disabled veterans approved under VA Program of Comprehensive Assistance for Family Caregivers.
eligibility: OR primary family caregiver (VA PCAFC approved)
benefit_amount: $150,000 market value exclusion from property taxes
how_to_apply: Apply with County Assessor by December 31; annual filing required

name: Property Tax Exclusion ($300,000)
description: Up to $300,000 market value exclusion from property taxes for veterans with 100% permanent and total VA disability rating. Substantial financial relief for homeownership. Also extends to surviving spouses (apply within 2 years of veteran's death).
eligibility: 100% permanent and total VA disability rating
benefit_amount: $300,000 market value exclusion from property taxes
how_to_apply: Apply with County Assessor by December 31; annual filing required

name: Military Pay Income Tax Exemption
description: Active duty military pay is completely exempt from Minnesota state income tax. Includes active duty, Minnesota National Guard, and Reservists. Re-enlistment bonuses also exempt. Must file tax subtraction Form M1M to receive exemption.
benefit_amount: 100% exemption on military active duty pay + re-enlistment bonuses
how_to_apply: File tax subtraction using Form M1M

name: Military Retirement Pay Tax Exemption
description: Military retirement pay is completely exempt from Minnesota state income tax. Makes Minnesota attractive for retired veterans. Must file tax subtraction to receive exemption.
benefit_amount: 100% exemption on military retirement pay
how_to_apply: File tax subtraction using Form M1M

name: Survivor Benefit Plan Tax Exemption
description: Survivor Benefit Plan (SBP) payments are completely exempt from Minnesota state income tax.
benefit_amount: 100% exemption on SBP payments
how_to_apply: Exclude from Minnesota income tax return

name: Past Military Service Tax Credit
description: Tax credit worth up to $750 for qualifying veterans. Applies to active duty, National Guard, and Reservist veterans. Adjusted gross income must be below $37,500. Cannot claim this AND military retirement pay subtractionâ€”must choose one.
eligibility: Minnesota resident veteran, Guard, or Reserve
Cannot claim if using retirement pay subtraction
benefit_amount: Up to $750 tax credit
how_to_apply: Complete Schedule M1C (Nonrefundable Credits)

name: Combat Zone Tax Credit
description: $120 tax credit for EACH MONTH served in qualifying combat zone or hazardous duty area. Can qualify even if owe no tax (refundable). Areas include Afghanistan, Kosovo, Arabian Peninsula, former Yugoslavia, Sinai Peninsula. Surviving family members may also apply. Must file within 3.5 years.
eligibility: Minnesota resident who served in qualifying combat zone
File within 3.5 years of original tax return
benefit_amount: $120 per month served in combat zone (refundable)
how_to_apply: Complete Form M99 (or Form M23 for surviving family)

name: Veterans Employment Preference Points
description: Veterans receive 5 preference points in Minnesota state and local government hiring. Veterans with service-connected disability receive 10 preference points. Applies to competitive and excepted service positions.
eligibility: OR veteran with service-connected disability (10 points)
Applying for state or local government position
benefit_amount: 5 points (all veterans) or 10 points (disabled veterans)
how_to_apply: Indicate veteran status on state/local employment applications

name: Minnesota Workforce Development Veteran Services
description: 15 regional offices providing job search assistance, resume workshops, training programs, and VA Vocational Rehabilitation coordination for Minnesota veterans.
benefit_amount: Free employment services and career assistance
how_to_apply: Contact Iowa Workforce Development regional office

name: VetLaw Legal Assistance Program
description: Minnesota Assistance Council for Veterans' VetLaw program helps veterans address legal issues presenting barriers to employment or housing. Includes evictions, child support, DUI/DWI, driver's license suspension/revocation, back taxes, defaulted student loans.
eligibility: Legal issues affecting employment or housing
benefit_amount: Free legal assistance for qualifying issues
how_to_apply: Contact Minnesota Assistance Council for Veterans

name: FREE Hunting and Fishing (100% Disabled Veterans)
description: Veterans with 100% service-connected disability receive: FREE small game license, FREE deer license (one per year), first preference in special hunt drawings and lotteries, and FREE permanent angling license.
benefit_amount: FREE small game + deer + permanent angling licenses + hunt preference
how_to_apply: Apply through Minnesota Department of Natural Resources with VA documentation

name: Active Duty Hunting Preference
description: Resident military personnel submitting preference application receive first preference in drawings for special hunts and lotteries.
benefit_amount: First preference in hunt drawings and lotteries
how_to_apply: Submit preference application through Minnesota DNR

name: Small Game Hunting on Leave (No License Required)
description: Resident service members on leave who have maintained legal Minnesota residency may hunt small game without a license while on leave. Must have appropriate federal stamps.
benefit_amount: FREE small game hunting on leave (federal stamps still required)
how_to_apply: Present military ID and leave papers while hunting

name: Veterans Home Fishing Benefit
description: Patients of Minnesota veterans homes may fish without a license with written permission from the institution.
benefit_amount: FREE fishing for veterans home patients
how_to_apply: Obtain written permission from veterans home administrator

name: Minnesota Veterans Homes
description: Five state-operated veterans homes providing skilled nursing care plus one Adult Day Care Center in Minneapolis. Skilled nursing, long-term care, and adult daycare services for eligible Minnesota veterans and spouses.
benefit_amount: Subsidized skilled nursing and long-term care (5 homes + 1 daycare)
how_to_apply: Contact Minnesota Department of Veterans Affairs for admissions

name: Subsistence Financial Assistance
description: Temporary financial aid (up to 6 months) for eligible veterans and dependents unable to work due to temporary disability OR permanently disabled while waiting for permanent disability benefits. Covers rent, mortgage, utilities, health insurance premiums. Medical documentation required; must have been employed within 1 year.
eligibility: Unable to work normal occupation due to temporary disability
OR permanently disabled waiting for VA/SS benefits
benefit_amount: Up to 6 months assistance: rent/mortgage, utilities, insurance premiums
how_to_apply: Apply through County Veterans Service Officer (CVSO)

name: Special Needs Grant
description: One-time financial assistance to veteran or surviving spouse to assist in financial stability and prevent homelessness. Grants awarded for housing costs and repairs, medical expenses, auto repairs, and other needs promoting stability.
eligibility: Minnesota resident veteran OR surviving spouse
Need for specific assistance (housing, medical, auto, etc.)
benefit_amount: One-time grant (amount varies by need)
how_to_apply: Apply through County Veterans Service Officer (CVSO)

name: SOAR Homeless Veterans Assistance
description: SOAR (SSI/SSDI Outreach, Access, and Recovery) partnership helps homeless and at-risk veterans with mental illness, medical impairment, or substance use disorder access Social Security Income (SSI) and Social Security Disability Insurance (SSDI) benefits.
eligibility: Homeless or at risk of homelessness
Mental illness OR medical impairment OR substance use disorder
benefit_amount: Assistance accessing SSI/SSDI benefits
how_to_apply: Contact County Veterans Service Officer or call 888-LinkVet (888-546-5838)

name: Former POW Sales Tax Exemption
description: Former prisoners of war are completely exempt from paying Minnesota sales tax on purchases.
benefit_amount: 100% sales tax exemption
how_to_apply: Present POW documentation at point of sale

name: VA Vehicle Modification Tax Exemption
description: If VA helped modify your vehicle, you're exempt from paying both registration tax AND sales tax on that vehicle. File Claim for Motor Vehicle Refund.
benefit_amount: Registration tax + sales tax exemption
how_to_apply: File Claim for Motor Vehicle Refund with Minnesota DVS
